text: hello this is Bill Cunningham just back
from the Paris spring fashion shows and
the end of the international fashion
presentation season and when I was in
New York I was fascinated by the number
of women wearing fluorescent orange and
the buildings under construction often
totally wrapped I like the oddest Cristo
in orange fluorescent netting when I got
to Paris I was on my way to a show on
the metro that's a subway glancing out
the window and I couldn't believe it
someone had lackin over in the orange
the side of the building I thought my
god what's going on and it is a building
that the city of Paris has condemned and
they are going to implode at any rate
they had invited as many artists who
wanted to come to create art on the
facades of the building and the
interiors and the building was open to
tourists and art lovers who want to see
what the artists had created well it was
simply marvelous and it occurred to me
the people are always asking me what
makes Paris so special why is it
different here's your answer your answer
is right here in the simplest
manifestation you could possibly think
of the construction and demolition sites
or buildings in New York very
utilitarian very functional here you are
in Paris they invite in the artists and
with enormous poetry and the fashion
follows it isn't the fast commercial
fashion that we find is now overtaken
Fifth Avenue they don't want to wear the
same thing someone else has they find
something that's a little different
